original_title: Sri Lanka rupee closes weaker at 301.00/30, bond yields up
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee closed weaker at 301.00/30 to the US dollar on Wednesday, from 300.60/75 on Tuesday, dealers said, while bond yields were up.
Trading in the secondary market was subdued ahead of the auction tomorrow (12).
A bond maturing on 01.07.2028 closed at 13.40/55 percent, up from 13.30.45 percent. (Colombo/Sep11/2024)
